001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.ByteArray;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.IntIntMap;
011import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.StreamUtils;
012import squidpony.annotation.GwtIncompatible;
013
014import java.io.DataOutputStream;
015import java.io.IOException;
016import java.io.OutputStream;
017import java.util.zip.Deflater;
018import java.util.zip.DeflaterOutputStream;
019
020/** PNG-8 encoder with compression. An instance can be reused to encode multiple PNGs with minimal allocation.
021 * You can configure the target palette and how this can dither colors via the {@link #palette} field, which is a
022 * {@link PaletteReducer} object that is allowed to be null and can be reused. The methods
023 * {@link PaletteReducer#exact(Color[])} or {@link PaletteReducer#analyze(Pixmap)} can be used to make the target
024 * palette match a specific set of colors or the colors in an existing image. You can use
025 * {@link PaletteReducer#setDitherStrength(float)} to reduce (or increase) dither strength; the dithering algorithm used
026 * here is a modified version of the algorithm presented in "Simple gradient-based error-diffusion method" by Xaingyu Y.
027 * Hu in the Journal of Electronic Imaging, 2016. This algorithm uses pseudo-randomly-generated noise (it is
028 * deterministic, and is seeded using the color information) to adjust Floyd-Steinberg dithering. It yields
029 * surprisingly non-random-looking dithers, but still manages to break up artificial patterns most of the time.
030 * Note that much of the time you will want to use {@link #writePrecisely(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean)} instead of
031 * {@link #write(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean, boolean)}, since writePrecisely will attempt to reproduce the exact colors
032 * if there are 256 colors or less in the Pixmap, and will automatically change to calling write() if there are more
033 * than 256 colors.
034 * <br>
035 * From LibGDX in the class PixmapIO, with modifications to support indexed-mode files, dithering, and other features.
036 * <pre>
037 * Copyright (c) 2007 Matthias Mann - www.matthiasmann.de
038 * Copyright (c) 2014 Nathan Sweet
039 * Copyright (c) 2018 Tommy Ettinger
040 *
041 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
042 * of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
043 * in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
044 * to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
045 * copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
046 * furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:
047 *
048 * The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in
049 * all copies or substantial portions of the Software.
050 *
051 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
052 * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
053 * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE
054 * AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER
055 * LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,
056 * OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN
057 * THE SOFTWARE.
058 * </pre>
059 * @author Matthias Mann
060 * @author Nathan Sweet
061 * @author Tommy Ettinger (PNG-8 parts only) */
062
063// If you're porting this into libGDX, remove the GwtIncompatible annotation and exclude this from GWT reflection.
064// You'll also need to include the PaletteReducer class, which only depends on libGDX and the JDK, and does not need to
065// be excluded from GWT in any way. The ChunkBuffer class this depends on is a static inner class in libGDX's PixmapIO;
066// it is package-private so it is duplicated here.
067@GwtIncompatible
068public class PNG8 implements Disposable {
069    static private final byte[] SIGNATURE = {(byte)137, 80, 78, 71, 13, 10, 26, 10};
070    static private final int IHDR = 0x49484452, IDAT = 0x49444154, IEND = 0x49454E44,
071            PLTE = 0x504C5445, TRNS = 0x74524E53,
072            acTL = 0x6163544C, fcTL = 0x6663544C, fdAT = 0x66644154;
073    static private final byte COLOR_INDEXED = 3;
074    static private final byte COMPRESSION_DEFLATE = 0;
075    static private final byte FILTER_NONE = 0;
076    static private final byte INTERLACE_NONE = 0;
077    static private final byte PAETH = 4;
078
079    private final ChunkBuffer buffer;
080    private final Deflater deflater;
081    private ByteArray lineOutBytes, curLineBytes, prevLineBytes;
082    private boolean flipY = true;
083    private int lastLineLen;
084
085    public PaletteReducer palette;
086    
087    public PNG8() {
088        this(128 * 128);
089    }
090
091    public PNG8(int initialBufferSize) {
092        buffer = new ChunkBuffer(initialBufferSize);
093        deflater = new Deflater();
094    }
095
096    /** If true, the resulting PNG is flipped vertically. Default is true. */
097    public void setFlipY (boolean flipY) {
098        this.flipY = flipY;
099    }
100
101    /** Sets the deflate compression level. Default is {@link Deflater#DEFAULT_COMPRESSION}. */
102    public void setCompression (int level) {
103        deflater.setLevel(level);
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * Writes the given Pixmap to the requested FileHandle, computing an 8-bit palette from the most common colors in
108     * pixmap. If there are 256 or less colors and none are transparent, this will use 256 colors in its palette exactly
109     * with no transparent entry, but if there are more than 256 colors or any are transparent, then one color will be
110     * used for "fully transparent" and 255 opaque colors will be used.
111     * @param file a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
112     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given file
113     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
114     */
115    public void write (FileHandle file, Pixmap pixmap) throws IOException {
116        write(file, pixmap, true);
117    }
118
119    /**
120     * Writes the given Pixmap to the requested FileHandle, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the most common
121     * colors in pixmap. When computePalette is true, if there are 256 or less colors and none are transparent, this
122     * will use 256 colors in its palette exactly with no transparent entry, but if there are more than 256 colors or
123     * any are transparent, then one color will be used for "fully transparent" and 255 opaque colors will be used. When
124     * computePalette is false, this uses the last palette this had computed, or a 253-color bold palette with one
125     * fully-transparent color if no palette had been computed yet.
126     * @param file a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
127     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given file
128     * @param computePalette if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
129     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
130     */
131    public void write (FileHandle file, Pixmap pixmap, boolean computePalette) throws IOException {
132        OutputStream output = file.write(false);
133        try {
134            write(output, pixmap, computePalette);
135        } finally {
136            StreamUtils.closeQuietly(output);
137        }
138    }
139    /**
140     * Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given
141     * Pixmap. If {@link #palette} is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will
142     * compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette. Optionally dithers the result if
143     * {@code dither} is true.
144     * @param file a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
145     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
146     * @param computePalette if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
147     * @param dither true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
148     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
149     */
150    public void write (FileHandle file, Pixmap pixmap, boolean computePalette, boolean dither) throws IOException {
151        OutputStream output = file.write(false);
152        try {
153            write(output, pixmap, computePalette, dither);
154        } finally {
155            StreamUtils.closeQuietly(output);
156        }
157    }
158    /**
159     * Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given
160     * Pixmap. If {@link #palette} is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will
161     * compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette. Uses the given threshold while analyzing
162     * the palette if this needs to compute a palette; threshold values can be as low as 0 to try to use as many colors
163     * as possible (prefer {@link  #writePrecisely(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean, int)} for that, though) and can range up
164     * to very high numbers if very few colors should be used; usually threshold is from 100 to 800. Optionally dithers
165     * the result if {@code dither} is true.
166     * @param file a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
167     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
168     * @param computePalette if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
169     * @param dither true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
170     * @param threshold the analysis threshold to use if computePalette is true (min 0, practical max is over 100000)
171     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
172     */
173    public void write (FileHandle file, Pixmap pixmap, boolean computePalette, boolean dither, int threshold) throws IOException {
174        OutputStream output = file.write(false);
175        try {
176            write(output, pixmap, computePalette, dither, threshold);
177        } finally {
178            StreamUtils.closeQuietly(output);
179        }
180    }
181
182    /** Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream and computes an 8-bit palette from the Pixmap.
183     * @param output an OutputStream that will not be closed
184     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
185     */
186    public void write (OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap) throws IOException {
187        writePrecisely(output, pixmap, true);
188    }
189
190    /**
191     * Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given
192     * Pixmap. If {@link #palette} is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will
193     * compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette.
194     * @param output an OutputStream that will not be closed
195     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
196     * @param computePalette if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
197     */
198    public void write (OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap, boolean computePalette) throws IOException     
199    {
200        if(computePalette)
201            writePrecisely(output, pixmap, true);
202        else
203            write(output, pixmap, false, true);
204    }
205
206    /**
207     * Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given
208     * Pixmap. If {@link #palette} is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will
209     * compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette.
210     * @param output an OutputStream that will not be closed
211     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
212     * @param computePalette if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
213     * @param dither true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
214     */
215    public void write (OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap, boolean computePalette, boolean dither) throws IOException
216    {
217        write(output, pixmap, computePalette, dither, 400);
218    }
219    /**
220     * Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given
221     * Pixmap. If {@link #palette} is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will
222     * compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette.
223     * @param output an OutputStream that will not be closed
224     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
225     * @param computePalette if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
226     * @param dither true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
227     * @param threshold the analysis threshold to use if computePalette is true (min 0, practical max is over 100000)
228     */
229    public void write (OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap, boolean computePalette, boolean dither, int threshold) throws IOException
230    {
231        if(palette == null)
232        {
233            palette = new PaletteReducer(pixmap, threshold);
234        }
235        else if(computePalette)
236        {
237            palette.analyze(pixmap, threshold);
238        }
239
240        if(dither) writeDithered(output, pixmap);
241        else writeSolid(output, pixmap);
242    }
243    /**
244     * Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to file; this attempt will only succeed if there
245     * are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent).
246     * If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling {@link #write(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean, boolean)}, which
247     * can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will
248     * always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette. All other write() methods in this class will
249     * reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the
250     * non-alpha components of colors exactly.
251     * @param file a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
252     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
253     * @param ditherFallback if the Pixmap contains too many colors, this determines whether it will dither the output
254     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
255     */
256    public void writePrecisely (FileHandle file, Pixmap pixmap, boolean ditherFallback) throws IOException {
257        writePrecisely(file, pixmap, ditherFallback, 400);
258    }
259    /**
260     * Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to file; this attempt will only succeed if there
261     * are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent).
262     * If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling {@link #write(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean, boolean)}, which
263     * can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will
264     * always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette, using the given threshold for analysis (which is
265     * typically between 1 and 1000, and most often near 200-400). All other write() methods in this class will
266     * reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the
267     * non-alpha components of colors exactly.
268     * @param file a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
269     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
270     * @param ditherFallback if the Pixmap contains too many colors, this determines whether it will dither the output
271     * @param threshold the analysis threshold to use if there are too many colors (min 0, practical max is over 100000)
272     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
273     */
274    public void writePrecisely (FileHandle file, Pixmap pixmap, boolean ditherFallback, int threshold) throws IOException {
275        OutputStream output = file.write(false);
276        try {
277            writePrecisely(output, pixmap, ditherFallback, threshold);
278        } finally {
279            StreamUtils.closeQuietly(output);
280        }
281    }
282
283    /**
284     * Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to output; this attempt will only succeed if there
285     * are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent).
286     * If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling {@link #write(OutputStream, Pixmap, boolean, boolean)}, which
287     * can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will
288     * always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette. All other write() methods in this class will
289     * reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the
290     * non-alpha components of colors exactly.
291     * @param output an OutputStream that will not be closed
292     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
293     * @param ditherFallback if the Pixmap contains too many colors, this determines whether it will dither the output
294     * @throws IOException if OutputStream things fail for any reason
295     */
296    public void writePrecisely(OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap, boolean ditherFallback) throws IOException {
297        writePrecisely(output, pixmap, ditherFallback, 400);
298    }
299
300    /**
301     * Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to output; this attempt will only succeed if there
302     * are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent).
303     * If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling {@link #write(OutputStream, Pixmap, boolean, boolean)}, which
304     * can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will
305     * always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette, using the given threshold for analysis (which is
306     * typically between 1 and 1000, and most often near 200-400). All other write() methods in this class will
307     * reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the
308     * non-alpha components of colors exactly.
309     * @param output an OutputStream that will not be closed
310     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
311     * @param ditherFallback if the Pixmap contains too many colors, this determines whether it will dither the output
312     * @param threshold the analysis threshold to use if there are too many colors (min 0, practical max is over 100000)
313     * @throws IOException if OutputStream things fail for any reason
314     */
315    public void writePrecisely(OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap, boolean ditherFallback, int threshold) throws IOException {
316        IntIntMap colorToIndex = new IntIntMap(256);
317        colorToIndex.put(0, 0);
318        int color;
319        int hasTransparent = 0;
320        final int w = pixmap.getWidth(), h = pixmap.getHeight();
321        for (int y = 0; y < h; y++) {
322            int py = flipY ? (h - y - 1) : y;
323            for (int px = 0; px < w; px++) {
324                color = pixmap.getPixel(px, py);
325                if((color & 0xFE) != 0xFE) {
326                    if(hasTransparent == 0 && colorToIndex.size >= 256)                     
327                    {
328                        write(output, pixmap, true, ditherFallback, threshold);
329                        return;
330                    }
331                    hasTransparent = 1;
332                }
333                else if(!colorToIndex.containsKey(color))
334                {
335                    colorToIndex.put(color, colorToIndex.size & 255);
336                    if(colorToIndex.size == 257 && hasTransparent == 0)
337                    {
338                        colorToIndex.remove(0, 0);
339                    }
340                    if(colorToIndex.size > 256)
341                    {
342                        write(output, pixmap, true, ditherFallback, threshold);
343                        return;
344                    }
345                }
346            }
347        }
348        int[] paletteArray = new int[colorToIndex.size];
349        for(IntIntMap.Entry ent : colorToIndex)
350        {
351            paletteArray[ent.value] = ent.key;
352        }
353        DeflaterOutputStream deflaterOutput = new DeflaterOutputStream(buffer, deflater);
354        DataOutputStream dataOutput = new DataOutputStream(output);
355        dataOutput.write(SIGNATURE);
356
357        buffer.writeInt(IHDR);
358        buffer.writeInt(pixmap.getWidth());
359        buffer.writeInt(pixmap.getHeight());
360        buffer.writeByte(8); // 8 bits per component.
361        buffer.writeByte(COLOR_INDEXED);
362        buffer.writeByte(COMPRESSION_DEFLATE);
363        buffer.writeByte(FILTER_NONE);
364        buffer.writeByte(INTERLACE_NONE);
365        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
366
367        buffer.writeInt(PLTE);
368        for (int i = 0; i < paletteArray.length; i++) {
369            int p = paletteArray[i];
370            buffer.write(p>>>24);
371            buffer.write(p>>>16);
372            buffer.write(p>>>8);
373        }
374        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
375
376        if(hasTransparent == 1) {
377            buffer.writeInt(TRNS);
378            buffer.write(0);
379            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
380        }
381        buffer.writeInt(IDAT);
382        deflater.reset();
383
384        int lineLen = pixmap.getWidth();
385        byte[] lineOut, curLine, prevLine;
386        if (lineOutBytes == null) {
387            lineOut = (lineOutBytes = new ByteArray(lineLen)).items;
388            curLine = (curLineBytes = new ByteArray(lineLen)).items;
389            prevLine = (prevLineBytes = new ByteArray(lineLen)).items;
390        } else {
391            lineOut = lineOutBytes.ensureCapacity(lineLen);
392            curLine = curLineBytes.ensureCapacity(lineLen);
393            prevLine = prevLineBytes.ensureCapacity(lineLen);
394            for (int i = 0, n = lastLineLen; i < n; i++)
395            {
396                prevLine[i] = 0;
397            }
398        }
399
400        lastLineLen = lineLen;
401
402        for (int y = 0; y < h; y++) {
403            int py = flipY ? (h - y - 1) : y;
404            for (int px = 0; px < w; px++) {
405                color = pixmap.getPixel(px, py);
406                curLine[px] = (byte) colorToIndex.get(color, 0);
407            }
408
409            lineOut[0] = (byte)(curLine[0] - prevLine[0]);
410
411            //Paeth
412            for (int x = 1; x < lineLen; x++) {
413                int a = curLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
414                int b = prevLine[x] & 0xff;
415                int c = prevLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
416                int p = a + b - c;
417                int pa = p - a;
418                if (pa < 0) pa = -pa;
419                int pb = p - b;
420                if (pb < 0) pb = -pb;
421                int pc = p - c;
422                if (pc < 0) pc = -pc;
423                if (pa <= pb && pa <= pc)
424                    c = a;
425                else if (pb <= pc)
426                    c = b;
427                lineOut[x] = (byte)(curLine[x] - c);
428            }
429
430            deflaterOutput.write(PAETH);
431            deflaterOutput.write(lineOut, 0, lineLen);
432
433            byte[] temp = curLine;
434            curLine = prevLine;
435            prevLine = temp;
436        }
437        deflaterOutput.finish();
438        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
439
440        buffer.writeInt(IEND);
441        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
442
443        output.flush();
444
445    }
446    
447    private void writeSolid (OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap) throws IOException{
448        final int[] paletteArray = palette.paletteArray;
449        final byte[] paletteMapping = palette.paletteMapping;
450
451        DeflaterOutputStream deflaterOutput = new DeflaterOutputStream(buffer, deflater);
452        DataOutputStream dataOutput = new DataOutputStream(output);
453        dataOutput.write(SIGNATURE);
454
455        buffer.writeInt(IHDR);
456        buffer.writeInt(pixmap.getWidth());
457        buffer.writeInt(pixmap.getHeight());
458        buffer.writeByte(8); // 8 bits per component.
459        buffer.writeByte(COLOR_INDEXED);
460        buffer.writeByte(COMPRESSION_DEFLATE);
461        buffer.writeByte(FILTER_NONE);
462        buffer.writeByte(INTERLACE_NONE);
463        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
464
465        buffer.writeInt(PLTE);
466        for (int i = 0; i < paletteArray.length; i++) {
467            int p = paletteArray[i];
468            buffer.write(p>>>24);
469            buffer.write(p>>>16);
470            buffer.write(p>>>8);
471        }
472        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
473
474        boolean hasTransparent = false;
475        if(paletteArray[0] == 0) {
476            hasTransparent = true;
477            buffer.writeInt(TRNS);
478            buffer.write(0);
479            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
480        }
481        buffer.writeInt(IDAT);
482        deflater.reset();
483
484        int lineLen = pixmap.getWidth();
485        byte[] lineOut, curLine, prevLine;
486        if (lineOutBytes == null) {
487            lineOut = (lineOutBytes = new ByteArray(lineLen)).items;
488            curLine = (curLineBytes = new ByteArray(lineLen)).items;
489            prevLine = (prevLineBytes = new ByteArray(lineLen)).items;
490        } else {
491            lineOut = lineOutBytes.ensureCapacity(lineLen);
492            curLine = curLineBytes.ensureCapacity(lineLen);
493            prevLine = prevLineBytes.ensureCapacity(lineLen);
494            for (int i = 0, n = lastLineLen; i < n; i++)
495            {
496                prevLine[i] = 0;
497            }
498        }
499
500        lastLineLen = lineLen;
501
502        int color;
503        final int w = pixmap.getWidth(), h = pixmap.getHeight();
504        for (int y = 0; y < h; y++) {
505            int py = flipY ? (h - y - 1) : y;
506            for (int px = 0; px < w; px++) {
507                color = pixmap.getPixel(px, py);
508                if ((color & 0x80) == 0 && hasTransparent)
509                    curLine[px] = 0;
510                else {
511                    int rr = ((color >>> 24)       );
512                    int gg = ((color >>> 16) & 0xFF);
513                    int bb = ((color >>> 8)  & 0xFF);
514                    curLine[px] = paletteMapping[((rr << 7) & 0x7C00)
515                                    | ((gg << 2) & 0x3E0)
516                                    | ((bb >>> 3))];
517                }
518            }
519
520            lineOut[0] = (byte)(curLine[0] - prevLine[0]);
521
522            //Paeth
523            for (int x = 1; x < lineLen; x++) {
524                int a = curLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
525                int b = prevLine[x] & 0xff;
526                int c = prevLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
527                int p = a + b - c;
528                int pa = p - a;
529                if (pa < 0) pa = -pa;
530                int pb = p - b;
531                if (pb < 0) pb = -pb;
532                int pc = p - c;
533                if (pc < 0) pc = -pc;
534                if (pa <= pb && pa <= pc)
535                    c = a;
536                else if (pb <= pc)
537                    c = b;
538                lineOut[x] = (byte)(curLine[x] - c);
539            }
540
541            deflaterOutput.write(PAETH);
542            deflaterOutput.write(lineOut, 0, lineLen);
543
544            byte[] temp = curLine;
545            curLine = prevLine;
546            prevLine = temp;
547        }
548        deflaterOutput.finish();
549        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
550
551        buffer.writeInt(IEND);
552        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
553
554        output.flush();
555    }
556
557    private void writeDithered (OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap) throws IOException{
558        DeflaterOutputStream deflaterOutput = new DeflaterOutputStream(buffer, deflater);
559        final int[] paletteArray = palette.paletteArray;
560        final byte[] paletteMapping = palette.paletteMapping;
561        
562        DataOutputStream dataOutput = new DataOutputStream(output);
563        dataOutput.write(SIGNATURE);
564
565        buffer.writeInt(IHDR);
566        buffer.writeInt(pixmap.getWidth());
567        buffer.writeInt(pixmap.getHeight());
568        buffer.writeByte(8); // 8 bits per component.
569        buffer.writeByte(COLOR_INDEXED);
570        buffer.writeByte(COMPRESSION_DEFLATE);
571        buffer.writeByte(FILTER_NONE);
572        buffer.writeByte(INTERLACE_NONE);
573        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
574
575        buffer.writeInt(PLTE);
576        for (int i = 0; i < paletteArray.length; i++) {
577            int p = paletteArray[i];
578            buffer.write(p>>>24);
579            buffer.write(p>>>16);
580            buffer.write(p>>>8);
581        }
582        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
583
584        boolean hasTransparent = false;
585        if(paletteArray[0] == 0) {
586            hasTransparent = true;
587            buffer.writeInt(TRNS);
588            buffer.write(0);
589            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
590        }
591        buffer.writeInt(IDAT);
592        deflater.reset();
593
594        final int w = pixmap.getWidth(), h = pixmap.getHeight();
595        byte[] lineOut, curLine, prevLine;
596        if (lineOutBytes == null) {
597            lineOut = (lineOutBytes = new ByteArray(w)).items;
598            curLine = (curLineBytes = new ByteArray(w)).items;
599            prevLine = (prevLineBytes = new ByteArray(w)).items;
600        } else {
601            lineOut = lineOutBytes.ensureCapacity(w);
602            curLine = curLineBytes.ensureCapacity(w);
603            prevLine = prevLineBytes.ensureCapacity(w);
604            for (int i = 0, n = lastLineLen; i < n; i++)
605            {
606                prevLine[i] = 0;
607            }
608        }
609
610        lastLineLen = w;
611
612        int color;
613        float adj, str = palette.ditherStrength;
614        for (int y = 0; y < h; y++) {
615            int py = flipY ? (h - y - 1) : y;
616            for (int px = 0; px < w; px++) {
617                color = pixmap.getPixel(px, py) & 0xF8F8F880;
618                if ((color & 0x80) == 0 && hasTransparent)
619                    curLine[px] = 0;
620                else {
621                    adj = (((px * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL + py * 0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL >>> 40) * 0x1p-26f - 0x1p-3f) * str);
622                    color |= (color >>> 5 & 0x07070700) | 0xFE;
623                    int rr = MathUtils.clamp((int) (((color >>> 24)       ) * (1f - adj)), 0, 0xFF);
624                    int gg = MathUtils.clamp((int) (((color >>> 16) & 0xFF) * (1f + adj)), 0, 0xFF);
625                    int bb = MathUtils.clamp((int) (((color >>> 8)  & 0xFF) * (1f + adj)), 0, 0xFF);
626                    curLine[px] = paletteMapping[((rr << 7) & 0x7C00)
627                                    | ((gg << 2) & 0x3E0)
628                                    | ((bb >>> 3))];
629                }
630            }
631
632            lineOut[0] = (byte)(curLine[0] - prevLine[0]);
633
634            //Paeth
635            for (int x = 1; x < w; x++) {
636                int a = curLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
637                int b = prevLine[x] & 0xff;
638                int c = prevLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
639                int p = a + b - c;
640                int pa = p - a;
641                if (pa < 0) pa = -pa;
642                int pb = p - b;
643                if (pb < 0) pb = -pb;
644                int pc = p - c;
645                if (pc < 0) pc = -pc;
646                if (pa <= pb && pa <= pc)
647                    c = a;
648                else if (pb <= pc)
649                    c = b;
650                lineOut[x] = (byte)(curLine[x] - c);
651            }
652
653            deflaterOutput.write(PAETH);
654            deflaterOutput.write(lineOut, 0, w);
655
656            byte[] temp = curLine;
657            curLine = prevLine;
658            prevLine = temp;
659        }
660        deflaterOutput.finish();
661        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
662
663        buffer.writeInt(IEND);
664        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
665
666        output.flush();
667    }
668    /**
669     * Writes the sequence of pixmaps to the given FileHandle as an animated PNG. The animation will loop and will try
670     * to run at {@code fps} frames per second. This will use the default palette for {@link PaletteReducer} if
671     * {@link #palette} is null; if palette is already non-null, you can call {@link PaletteReducer#analyze(Pixmap)} to
672     * compute a palette from one image or exact() to match a specific palette. Always dithers the result using the
673     * Floyd-Steinberg algorithm.
674     *
675     * @param file   a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
676     * @param frames a Pixmap Array to write as a sequence of frames to the given output stream
677     * @param fps    how many frames per second the animation should run at
678     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
679     */
680    public void write(FileHandle file, Array<Pixmap> frames, int fps) throws IOException {
681        write(file, frames, fps, true);
682    }
683
684    /**
685     * Writes the sequence of pixmaps to the given FileHandle as an animated PNG. The animation will loop and will try
686     * to run at {@code fps} frames per second. This will use the default palette for {@link PaletteReducer} if
687     * {@link #palette} is null; if palette is already non-null, you can call {@link PaletteReducer#analyze(Pixmap)} to
688     * compute a palette from one image or exact() to match a specific palette. Optionally dithers the result if
689     * {@code dither} is true; dither uses the Floyd-Steinberg algorithm.
690     *
691     * @param file   a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
692     * @param frames a Pixmap Array to write as a sequence of frames to the given output stream
693     * @param fps    how many frames per second the animation should run at
694     * @param dither true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
695     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
696     */
697    public void write(FileHandle file, Array<Pixmap> frames, int fps, boolean dither) throws IOException {
698        OutputStream output = file.write(false);
699        try {
700            write(output, frames, fps, dither);
701        } finally {
702            StreamUtils.closeQuietly(output);
703        }
704    }
705
706    /**
707     * Writes the sequence of pixmaps to the stream without closing the stream. The animation will loop and will try
708     * to run at {@code fps} frames per second. This will use the default palette for {@link PaletteReducer} if
709     * {@link #palette} is null; if palette is already non-null, you can call {@link PaletteReducer#analyze(Pixmap)} to
710     * compute a palette from one image or exact() to match a specific palette. Optionally dithers the result if
711     * {@code dither} is true; dither uses the Floyd-Steinberg algorithm.
712     *
713     * @param output an OutputStream that will not be closed
714     * @param frames a Pixmap Array to write as a sequence of frames to the given output stream
715     * @param fps    how many frames per second the animation should run at
716     * @param dither true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
717     */
718    public void write(OutputStream output, Array<Pixmap> frames, int fps, boolean dither) throws IOException {
719        if (palette == null)
720            palette = new PaletteReducer();
721        if (dither)
722            writeDithered(output, frames, fps);
723        else
724            writeSolid(output, frames, fps);
725    }
726
727    private void writeSolid(OutputStream output, Array<Pixmap> frames, int fps) throws IOException {
728        Pixmap pixmap = frames.first();
729        final int[] paletteArray = palette.paletteArray;
730        final byte[] paletteMapping = palette.paletteMapping;
731
732        DeflaterOutputStream deflaterOutput = new DeflaterOutputStream(buffer, deflater);
733        DataOutputStream dataOutput = new DataOutputStream(output);
734        dataOutput.write(SIGNATURE);
735
736        final int width = pixmap.getWidth();
737        final int height = pixmap.getHeight();
738
739        buffer.writeInt(IHDR);
740        buffer.writeInt(width);
741        buffer.writeInt(height);
742        buffer.writeByte(8); // 8 bits per component.
743        buffer.writeByte(COLOR_INDEXED);
744        buffer.writeByte(COMPRESSION_DEFLATE);
745        buffer.writeByte(FILTER_NONE);
746        buffer.writeByte(INTERLACE_NONE);
747        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
748
749        buffer.writeInt(PLTE);
750        for (int i = 0; i < paletteArray.length; i++) {
751            int p = paletteArray[i];
752            buffer.write(p >>> 24);
753            buffer.write(p >>> 16);
754            buffer.write(p >>> 8);
755        }
756        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
757
758        boolean hasTransparent = false;
759        if (paletteArray[0] == 0) {
760            hasTransparent = true;
761            buffer.writeInt(TRNS);
762            buffer.write(0);
763            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
764        }
765        buffer.writeInt(acTL);
766        buffer.writeInt(frames.size);
767        buffer.writeInt(0);
768        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
769
770        byte[] lineOut, curLine, prevLine;
771        int color;
772        int seq = 0;
773        for (int i = 0; i < frames.size; i++) {
774
775            buffer.writeInt(fcTL);
776            buffer.writeInt(seq++);
777            buffer.writeInt(width);
778            buffer.writeInt(height);
779            buffer.writeInt(0);
780            buffer.writeInt(0);
781            buffer.writeShort(1);
782            buffer.writeShort(fps);
783            buffer.writeByte(0);
784            buffer.writeByte(0);
785            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
786
787            if (i == 0) {
788                buffer.writeInt(IDAT);
789            } else {
790                pixmap = frames.get(i);
791                buffer.writeInt(fdAT);
792                buffer.writeInt(seq++);
793            }
794            deflater.reset();
795
796            if (lineOutBytes == null) {
797                lineOut = (lineOutBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
798                curLine = (curLineBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
799                prevLine = (prevLineBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
800            } else {
801                lineOut = lineOutBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
802                curLine = curLineBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
803                prevLine = prevLineBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
804                for (int ln = 0, n = lastLineLen; ln < n; ln++)
805                    prevLine[ln] = 0;
806            }
807            lastLineLen = width;
808
809            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
810                int py = flipY ? (height - y - 1) : y;
811                for (int px = 0; px < width; px++) {
812                    color = pixmap.getPixel(px, py);
813                    if ((color & 0x80) == 0 && hasTransparent)
814                        curLine[px] = 0;
815                    else {
816                        int rr = ((color >>> 24));
817                        int gg = ((color >>> 16) & 0xFF);
818                        int bb = ((color >>> 8) & 0xFF);
819                        curLine[px] = paletteMapping[((rr << 7) & 0x7C00)
820                                | ((gg << 2) & 0x3E0)
821                                | ((bb >>> 3))];
822                    }
823                }
824
825                lineOut[0] = (byte) (curLine[0] - prevLine[0]);
826
827                //Paeth
828                for (int x = 1; x < width; x++) {
829                    int a = curLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
830                    int b = prevLine[x] & 0xff;
831                    int c = prevLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
832                    int p = a + b - c;
833                    int pa = p - a;
834                    if (pa < 0) pa = -pa;
835                    int pb = p - b;
836                    if (pb < 0) pb = -pb;
837                    int pc = p - c;
838                    if (pc < 0) pc = -pc;
839                    if (pa <= pb && pa <= pc)
840                        c = a;
841                    else if (pb <= pc)
842                        c = b;
843                    lineOut[x] = (byte) (curLine[x] - c);
844                }
845
846                deflaterOutput.write(PAETH);
847                deflaterOutput.write(lineOut, 0, width);
848
849                byte[] temp = curLine;
850                curLine = prevLine;
851                prevLine = temp;
852            }
853            deflaterOutput.finish();
854            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
855        }
856
857        buffer.writeInt(IEND);
858        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
859
860        output.flush();
861    }
862
863    private void writeDithered(OutputStream output, Array<Pixmap> frames, int fps) throws IOException {
864        Pixmap pixmap = frames.first();
865        final int[] paletteArray = palette.paletteArray;
866        final byte[] paletteMapping = palette.paletteMapping;
867
868        DeflaterOutputStream deflaterOutput = new DeflaterOutputStream(buffer, deflater);
869        DataOutputStream dataOutput = new DataOutputStream(output);
870        dataOutput.write(SIGNATURE);
871
872        final int width = pixmap.getWidth();
873        final int height = pixmap.getHeight();
874
875        buffer.writeInt(IHDR);
876        buffer.writeInt(width);
877        buffer.writeInt(height);
878        buffer.writeByte(8); // 8 bits per component.
879        buffer.writeByte(COLOR_INDEXED);
880        buffer.writeByte(COMPRESSION_DEFLATE);
881        buffer.writeByte(FILTER_NONE);
882        buffer.writeByte(INTERLACE_NONE);
883        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
884
885        buffer.writeInt(PLTE);
886        for (int i = 0; i < paletteArray.length; i++) {
887            int p = paletteArray[i];
888            buffer.write(p >>> 24);
889            buffer.write(p >>> 16);
890            buffer.write(p >>> 8);
891        }
892        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
893
894        boolean hasTransparent = false;
895        if (paletteArray[0] == 0) {
896            hasTransparent = true;
897            buffer.writeInt(TRNS);
898            buffer.write(0);
899            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
900        }
901        buffer.writeInt(acTL);
902        buffer.writeInt(frames.size);
903        buffer.writeInt(0);
904        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
905
906        byte[] lineOut, curLine, prevLine;
907        byte[] curErrorRed, nextErrorRed, curErrorGreen, nextErrorGreen, curErrorBlue, nextErrorBlue;
908        int color;
909        if (palette.curErrorRedBytes == null) {
910            curErrorRed = (palette.curErrorRedBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
911            nextErrorRed = (palette.nextErrorRedBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
912            curErrorGreen = (palette.curErrorGreenBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
913            nextErrorGreen = (palette.nextErrorGreenBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
914            curErrorBlue = (palette.curErrorBlueBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
915            nextErrorBlue = (palette.nextErrorBlueBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
916        } else {
917            curErrorRed = palette.curErrorRedBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
918            nextErrorRed = palette.nextErrorRedBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
919            curErrorGreen = palette.curErrorGreenBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
920            nextErrorGreen = palette.nextErrorGreenBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
921            curErrorBlue = palette.curErrorBlueBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
922            nextErrorBlue = palette.nextErrorBlueBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
923            for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
924                nextErrorRed[i] = 0;
925                nextErrorGreen[i] = 0;
926                nextErrorBlue[i] = 0;
927            }
928        }
929
930        lastLineLen = width;
931
932        int used, rdiff, gdiff, bdiff;
933        byte er, eg, eb, paletteIndex;
934        float w1 = palette.ditherStrength * 0.125f, w3 = w1 * 3f, w5 = w1 * 5f, w7 = w1 * 7f;
935
936        int seq = 0;
937        for (int i = 0; i < frames.size; i++) {
938
939            buffer.writeInt(fcTL);
940            buffer.writeInt(seq++);
941            buffer.writeInt(width);
942            buffer.writeInt(height);
943            buffer.writeInt(0);
944            buffer.writeInt(0);
945            buffer.writeShort(1);
946            buffer.writeShort(fps);
947            buffer.writeByte(0);
948            buffer.writeByte(0);
949            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
950
951            if (i == 0) {
952                buffer.writeInt(IDAT);
953            } else {
954                pixmap = frames.get(i);
955                buffer.writeInt(fdAT);
956                buffer.writeInt(seq++);
957            }
958            deflater.reset();
959
960            if (lineOutBytes == null) {
961                lineOut = (lineOutBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
962                curLine = (curLineBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
963                prevLine = (prevLineBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
964            } else {
965                lineOut = lineOutBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
966                curLine = curLineBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
967                prevLine = prevLineBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
968                for (int ln = 0, n = lastLineLen; ln < n; ln++)
969                    prevLine[ln] = 0;
970            }
971            lastLineLen = width;
972
973            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
974                int py = flipY ? (height - y - 1) : y;
975                int ny = flipY ? (height - y - 2) : y + 1;
976                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
977                    curErrorRed[x] = nextErrorRed[x];
978                    curErrorGreen[x] = nextErrorGreen[x];
979                    curErrorBlue[x] = nextErrorBlue[x];
980                    nextErrorRed[x] = 0;
981                    nextErrorGreen[x] = 0;
982                    nextErrorBlue[x] = 0;
983                }
984                for (int px = 0; px < width; px++) {
985                    color = pixmap.getPixel(px, py) & 0xF8F8F880;
986                    if ((color & 0x80) == 0 && hasTransparent)
987                        curLine[px] = 0;
988                    else {
989                        er = curErrorRed[px];
990                        eg = curErrorGreen[px];
991                        eb = curErrorBlue[px];
992                        color |= (color >>> 5 & 0x07070700) | 0xFE;
993                        int rr = MathUtils.clamp(((color >>> 24)) + (er), 0, 0xFF);
994                        int gg = MathUtils.clamp(((color >>> 16) & 0xFF) + (eg), 0, 0xFF);
995                        int bb = MathUtils.clamp(((color >>> 8) & 0xFF) + (eb), 0, 0xFF);
996                        curLine[px] = paletteIndex =
997                                paletteMapping[((rr << 7) & 0x7C00)
998                                        | ((gg << 2) & 0x3E0)
999                                        | ((bb >>> 3))];
1000                        used = paletteArray[paletteIndex & 0xFF];
1001                        rdiff = (color >>> 24) - (used >>> 24);
1002                        gdiff = (color >>> 16 & 255) - (used >>> 16 & 255);
1003                        bdiff = (color >>> 8 & 255) - (used >>> 8 & 255);
1004                        if (px < width - 1) {
1005                            curErrorRed[px + 1] += rdiff * w7;
1006                            curErrorGreen[px + 1] += gdiff * w7;
1007                            curErrorBlue[px + 1] += bdiff * w7;
1008                        }
1009                        if (ny < height) {
1010                            if (px > 0) {
1011                                nextErrorRed[px - 1] += rdiff * w3;
1012                                nextErrorGreen[px - 1] += gdiff * w3;
1013                                nextErrorBlue[px - 1] += bdiff * w3;
1014                            }
1015                            if (px < width - 1) {
1016                                nextErrorRed[px + 1] += rdiff * w1;
1017                                nextErrorGreen[px + 1] += gdiff * w1;
1018                                nextErrorBlue[px + 1] += bdiff * w1;
1019                            }
1020                            nextErrorRed[px] += rdiff * w5;
1021                            nextErrorGreen[px] += gdiff * w5;
1022                            nextErrorBlue[px] += bdiff * w5;
1023                        }
1024                    }
1025                }
1026                lineOut[0] = (byte) (curLine[0] - prevLine[0]);
1027
1028                //Paeth
1029                for (int x = 1; x < width; x++) {
1030                    int a = curLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
1031                    int b = prevLine[x] & 0xff;
1032                    int c = prevLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
1033                    int p = a + b - c;
1034                    int pa = p - a;
1035                    if (pa < 0) pa = -pa;
1036                    int pb = p - b;
1037                    if (pb < 0) pb = -pb;
1038                    int pc = p - c;
1039                    if (pc < 0) pc = -pc;
1040                    if (pa <= pb && pa <= pc)
1041                        c = a;
1042                    else if (pb <= pc)
1043                        c = b;
1044                    lineOut[x] = (byte) (curLine[x] - c);
1045                }
1046
1047                deflaterOutput.write(PAETH);
1048                deflaterOutput.write(lineOut, 0, width);
1049
1050                byte[] temp = curLine;
1051                curLine = prevLine;
1052                prevLine = temp;
1053            }
1054            deflaterOutput.finish();
1055            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
1056        }
1057
1058        buffer.writeInt(IEND);
1059        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
1060
1061        output.flush();
1062    }
1063
1064    /** Should probably be done explicitly; finalize() has been scheduled for removal from the JVM. */
1065    public void dispose () {
1066        deflater.end();
1067    }
1068}
